153001.description:
A player wins the game if he hits five goals, or hits the most goals inside a prearranged time. Each player has five meeples, but plays only one meeple (ball) at a time. If he hits a goal, he uses the next meeple. The movement of the meeples is determined by a die. When a ball gets on a space of its own color it gets kicked forward along the arrow. If it gets on a space of the opponents color, it gets kicked back. The game board has two sides, a simple one and one that's more complex.

The game was made in GDR.
153001.name: Original Fußball-Würfel-Spiel

153002.description:
It's a race for the treasure in Koboldbande, with the player kobolds working together to create a path to the treasure before the dragon can get its talons into the chest first.

Before the game begins, players seed the 6x8 game board with four keys and a candy tile by rolling two dice — one color, and another symbol — and placing the tiles on the appropriate locations on the game board. Shuffle the 27 path tiles and 10 dragon tiles together.

On a turn, a player draws a tile. If it's a dragon tile, she places it on the first empty space on the dragon path; if a path tile, she places it at the end of a path already on the board. (The first path tile is placed in the upper-left square of the game board, while the treasure is below the lower-right square.) If the path is placed on a key, the players claim the key. If the path crosses the candies, the players can place one dragon tile on the candies, delaying the dragon on its way to the treasure.

Once the players have collected three keys, they can then lay a tile on the treasure chest — and if they reach the treasure before the dragon does, they win!
153002.name: Koboldbande

153003.name: Ciudades Paralelas
153003.description:
Ciudades Paralelas is a two player board game. In parallel cities, players are urbanists from the future. The space-time is broken. Too many worlds are crossing.

Each player is the same person but in a different world. The actions that the players do in their turn have repercussions on the opponent's board. The players must build the city with special attention to the benefits or the losses from their decisions.

153004.description:
With a name like Lemminge, you know you're going to be racing little rodents across a finish line of some sort, and this design lives up to that promise. Each player controls two lemmings that must make their way across a game board of hexagonal spaces; most spaces contain grassland and can be entered no matter which card a player lays down, but some spaces contain special terrain (water, hills, etc.) that can be entered only when the appropriate card is played.

Each player starts with 2-6 cards in hand, with the number dependent on the player count. On a turn, a player either:


Discards any number of cards from hand, then refills her hand to six cards, or
Plays a card, then moves one of her lemmings.


Each card is one of five landscape types and numbered 0-4. If the card played is equal to or lower than the value of the top landscape card of the same type, then the player adds the values of all landscape cards of this type, then moves her lemming up to this many spaces, crossing grassland and the depicted landscape type freely. If the card is higher than the top card of the depicted landscape type, then discard all cards of this type and start a new pile. Before moving her lemming, though, she places a bonus landscape hex of this type on the game board — ideally stifling the future movement of her opponents while scooting her own lemming further toward the goal.

If one or more lemmings are in your intended path of movement, you can push them aside before moving into the space, spending one point of movement for each lemming so moved. You can push your own lemming, if you set them up right — even across the finish line.

The first player to move both of her lemmings across the finish line wins.
153004.name: Lemminge
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ53: Lemminge (2014) Sebastian Bleasdale

153005.name: Gary Lineker's Superstar Soccer
videogameversion: English/European ZX Spectrum (Kixx Re-release) Cassette edition
153005.description:
From the inlay:

Welcome to GARY LINEKER'S SUPERSTAR SOCCER, the most exciting soccer simulation yet! Passes, dribbling, injuries - GARY LINEKER'S SUPERSTAR SOCCER packs in all the realism and excitement of real outdoor soccer, combining the hectic demands of team management and coaching with the talent needed to be a 'Star Striker!'

It's YOUR team and it's your goal to turn it into championship material ...

User Summary

This is a Soccer game. The original Commodore 64 version has very light management, with the player only having the option to make coaching decisions in-game. The Spectrum and Amstrad versions have considerably more management options between games, with the ability to buy and sell players as well as to spend money on training your team.

When playing a game, the option is given whether to play or not, and / or whether to Coach or not. It is possible to set both playing and coaching to "Computer" if you wish to simply observe the results of your management skills. In the Commodore 64 version only, a second player can be set to play the opposing team. In addition, if the user decides to play the match, they have a choice in the Commodore version to either play the Goalkeeper only, or the other players on the pitch.

153006.name: Raw Recruit
153006.description:
From the inlay:

That's you, as raw as they come, and your first introduction to army life is a set of six challenging events that will decide whether you are suitable material for a crack commando regiment. Failure to qualify for any one event will result in you not being selected for the squad. But there's one consolation: even if you don't qualify, a good performance may win you a place among the highest scorers. And, who knows, the regiment may offer you a second chance.

User Summary:

This is a military-themed mini-game compilation in the Combat School mould.

The six events are as follows:

Rifle Range
Cross Country
Fitness Course
Assault Course
Pistol Range
Tug O' War

The two shooting events involve moving a cross-hair around the screen to shoot targets which appear across a target range. The other events are joystick-wagglers where the aim is to complete the activity in the fastest time possible, but while keeping an eye on the available energy reserve.

153007.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 335 - Jul 2003)
153007.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #335
July 2003

Cover art by Susan Landerman.

153008.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 336 - Aug 2003)
153008.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #336
August 2003

Cover art by Simon Barber.

153009.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 337 - Sep 2003)
153009.description:
Alarums & Excursions

September 2003

Cover art by David T. Okamura.

153011.description:
This is an exclusive mini-expansion for backers of the 2013 Kickstarter campaign.

Consists of a pack of five cards, four titled "Master Engineer", and one event card called "Ghost in the Machine".
153011.name: Professor Pugnacious: Kickstarter Exclusive Promos

153012.description:
Includes three promo strikers that are shuffled in with your other strikers and used in much the same way, but of course offering different powers:

Larimore Burman

(S) Tyrant Fury
(A)Dragon Buster
(B)Relentless Advance





Juto

(S)Bear Hug
(A)Copycat
(B)Strangely Familiar





Borneo

(S)Awakening
(A)Copycat
(B)Oddly Familiar





Originally available to backers of the 2013 Devastation Kickstarter campaign.
153012.name: BattleCON: Strikers – Promo Pack

153013.name: Ene mene miste...
153013.description:
Players in Ene mene miste... need to keep a sharp eye on the chalkboards to see — and sum — the items that appear more than once.

To start the game, lay out the two starting chalkboard cards, then shuffle the remaining 28 cards face-down and set 14 out of play. Turn the top card face-up and place it near the starting cards. If anyone spots an item — or multiple items — that appears on two or three cards, she yells out the combined sum of all items that appear on two or three cards. For example, if three bananas appear on one card and two on another, yell out "Five!"; if in addition one pear appears on a card and one pear appears on another, yell out "Seven!" Each player can yell out at most one number, and whoever first yells the correct sum claims one of the face-up cards, then replaces it with the top card of the deck. Whoever claims the most cards wins.

With younger players, you can lay out only two cards at a time to keep the sums smaller and minimize the calculation; with older players, keep four cards in play, possibly adding more cards to the deck to make the game last longer.

153014.name: Yaminabe
153014.description: In this card game, players are trying to collect food items in order to cook a delicious pot of soup. Each food item card is printed with a positive or negative point value, based on how well it would go in the soup. Players are dealt a hand of cards, and then one player is designated as the Pot Master, a role that rotates each round. The Pot Master collects one card from each player, including himself, and then redistributes the cards face down. Players must decide whether to claim the face down card or trade it with another. The goal is to attain the highest point value after all cards have been claimed.

153015.description:
Hunt monsters, take their parts, forge equipment, brew potions, and battle for glory! Play our story and then build your own!

Legends of Rakasa consists of two base games (Fordra and Monsir), two Legendary Expansions for each base game, and the Alchemy Expansion. each base game comes with enough components to play 1-4 players. Adding players is no problem with no real player cap. Each base game comes with two lands and two road, each land can increase player count by two. 8 to 16 player games is not unheard of with this game. Players can play competitively or cooperatively.

Players start in the village with very basic bone equipment they must venture out to the roads and lands to battle monsters, collect spoils, use those spoils to upgrade their equipment so they can take on more challenging monsters, and ultimately striving to achieve the game objective. Players may also use market utilities items and Potion materials to assist them in their battle.

Rakasa was designed to be a vary versatile game where players may choose to play set objectives and game setup rules or design there own. The game is made up and played on individual land and road tiles with decks of cards for each. This system allows players to adjust their games to fit their interests or preferences.

the base games are set in the Land of Rakasa during the Life Crossing festival. Each year the people of this land celebrate the renewal of life and battle to prove their skills as a hunter. This is done by crafting stronger equipment and defeating the dragons found in each of the lands. Once hunters have proved themselves they can participate in the Mahakasa hunt which is the strongest and most ferocious monster in Rakasa. Hunters who gain parts or trophies from this creature earn the title of Hunter-Warrior, the highest title bestowed to people in the village.
153015.name: Legends of Rakasa

153016.description:
Are you ready to party with a bigger group? With the all new Telestrations Party Pack, you can have a LOL, side-splitting time with up to 12 people! Prepare for more players, more laughs, and more unpredictable results! The silly sketchin’ & guessin’ possibilities are endless!

Combining the schoolyard favorite ‘telephone game’ with a drawing game, Telestrations has players draw what they see then guess what they saw. The result? The Big Reveal, where players get to share how “this” became “that!” The outcomes are unpredictable and sure to create a slide-splitting time!
153016.name: Telestrations: 12 Player Party Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 41 - Viticulture Essential Edition BA Holiday Special
TPGC - Episode #28 - Pictionary and Telestrations Against Humanity and Anomia
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 54!!!!

153017.description:
You are a border collie trying to herd as many sheep as you can from the pasture into your pen, but your opponents have the same goal. Whenever the pasture (Sheep deck) is empty, the game is over and whoever has the most sheep in their pen is the winner.

On your turn, you will draw a card from the duty deck, and then you will perform two actions. Those actions are A) drawing a card from the duty deck B) playing a card from your hand or C) herding a sheep aka taking the top card from the sheep deck and putting it in your pasture.

Some of the sheep cards are rare sheep such as the Ninja Sheep, the Fat Sheep, the Buff Sheep, or the Goat. Each special sheep has a special ability printed on the card. Most of the sheep in the sheep deck are normal mundane sheep, however.

In the 30 min game some of the cards you will draw (duty cards) will help you herd more sheep or perform more actions, but many of the duty cards are harmful to your opponents, such as sending feral corgis to kidnap their sheep or even worse, infecting an opponent with rabies.
153017.name: Collie of Duty

153020.name: Board Game Heroes
153020.description:
A dice battle platform for your favorite board game hero/miniature or anything you want.

OVERVIEW

Board Game Heroes is especially designed for The Game Crafter and for people who like board games and MOBA (Multiplayer-Online Battle Arena) games. This game was made similar to MOBA and also designed for board/table top gamers, especially to those who like dice battle game. Basically, this game is a platform for your favorite board game heroes/miniatures. This serves as battle arena which battles thru dice result and skill cards.

OBJECTIVE

The objective of this game is to destroy the enemy base by pushing your opponent heroes until you reach their base; Each base has 5 life points and there are 14 tiles from your starting lane up to your opponents base. Gain Mana equal to the result of your movement and draw skill card whenever you stepped on the Blue Tile, use your skill card to either advance & stall your enemy on same lane.

153021.name: Hammerwatch
153021.description:
Hammerwatch is a fantasy-themed hack and slash adventure game, developed by Jochum Skoglund and Niklas Myrberg. It was mainly inspired by the Gauntlet games. The game was released through Steam Greenlight.

The gameplay is similar to Diablo and other hack and slash video games, in that the player(s) are in a castle and must kill hundreds of enemies. Unlike some games of the genre, there are no skill trees in Hammerwatch; instead the player buys skills from traders across the maps.

Hammerwatch has four character classes: paladin, wizard, ranger and warlock.

Edited from Wikipedia, "Hammerwatch," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

153022.name: The Bone-Hilt Sword Complete Campaign
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
153022.description:
From Lulu.com and user summary

In the innagural campaign for the Usherwood adventures; your party of adventurers battles kobolds, orcs, multitudes of undead, and dragons to stop a malevolent evil from consuming the entire continent of Vermé in this campaign that birthed the Usherwood Adventures. This single volume contains all five books

The Bone-Hilt Sword Campaign Book 1: Yrchyn, the Tyrant
The Bone-Hilt Sword Campaign Book 2: The Shattered Skull
The Bone-Hilt Sword Campaign Book 3: The Shadowed Keep
The Bone-Hilt Sword Campaign Book 4: Valen'cya's Horde
The Bone-Hilt Sword Campaign Book 5: In the Halls of the Mage-King

153023.name: Mandate Archive: Scavenger Fleets
153023.description:
publisher blurb


Nomads of the Uncharted Sky

They forge a path between forgotten worlds, bringing the treasures of foreign suns in exchange for the prices that only earthdwellers can pay. Open this free supplement for the equally free Stars Without Number RPG to learn of the Scavenger Fleets and their age-old trade between the far-flung worlds of humanity. The ruthless heirs of the Scream's shattered fleets, these ships will go anywhere and do anything to turn the profit they need to keep flying.

You'll find a history of the Scavenger Fleets in the Stars Without Number world, along with example fleets, tables for generating your own bands of nomadic scavenger-merchants, and a selection of new hulls and ship fittings to tantalize your players.

153024.name: Expanded Ephemeris Equipment List
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153024.description:
From publisher blurb:

The original Ephemeris rulebook didn't have room for a long equipment list, but we're making up for that now with 65 pages of equipment that you can use in your Ephemeris game.

153025.name: The Bandit's Sourcebook
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153025.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Bandit...now see what else you can do with the Bandit. The Bandit's Sourcebook features eight new sub-classes, as well as new skills, weapons, armor, and goods that are designed to help round out the Bandit class.

153026.name: The Cyber Wizard's Sourcebook
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153026.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Cyber Wizard...now see what else you can do with the Cyber Wizard. The Cyber Wizard's Sourcebook features new sub-classes, including specialist wizards, as well as new skills, weapons, cybernetics, goods, and spells that are designed to help round out the Cyber Wizard class.

153027.name: The Derelict Ship of the Ancients
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153027.description:
From publisher blurb:

A ship of unknown origins has been discovered drifting in the space between the Althani and Culthan sectors of space. As the ship is in what is "technically" considered to be neutral space, the Althani and the Culthan are aggressively negotiating what should be done with the ship. While they're negotiating, others have taken it upon themselves to investigate the ship without the blessing of either of the governments. Your party is one of these groups. You know that both governments might come after you because of what you're about to do, and you also know that you won't be the only group trying to discover the secrets of this ship, but it doesn't matter. It's a ship from the past, and you have no idea of what you might discover on the ship...and that alone makes it worth the risk.

An Ephemeris adventure for 4-6 characters of 6th-9th levels.

153028.name: The Nanist's Sourcebook
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153028.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Nanist...now see what else you can do with the Nanist. The Nanist's Sourcebook features new sub-classes, including the Nano-Possessed, as well as a new skill, new weapons, goods, and transferences that are designed to help round out the Nanist class.

153029.name: The Secrets of Gladsheim IV
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153029.description:
From publisher blurb:

It starts as a simple, routine delivery mission for the scientific research team on the newly discovered planet of Gladsheim IV. An abandoned research station will start a journey that leaves more questions than answers as the adventurers discover new species and explore a world that is much more than it seems.An Ephemeris RPG Adventure for 5th and 6th level characters.

153030.name: Sector Three (Melanathee Space)
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153030.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Melanathee are the oldest of the six major species in the Ephemeris universe. Now you can learn about their sector of space. Learn about the planets they've colonized, the systems they battle to try to control, and the systems that even they fear to enter.

The Ephemeris Encyclopedia Galactica will be a multi-volume collection looking at each sector of space. You can start with Sector Three (Melanathee Space).

153031.name: The Ephemeris Omnibus 2013
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
153031.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ephemeris Omnibus 2013 features the Ephemeris core rulebook (with some rule changes, including mutli-classing), and all of the rule supplements that have been released as of the end of 2012. All of the species and class supplements have been blended into the core rulebook to create a massive (over 200,000 words) rulebook that will allow you to play the most extensive Ephemeris game you'd ever want to play.

153032.name: The Battle for Turtle Island: Buffalo Wars
153032.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagine it's the 19th century, and the colonization/conquest of the Americas is underway yet again, only this time magic is real, and the Indians have a lot more of it than the colonists. This is the world of The Battle for Turtle Island: Buffalo Wars.

The colonists may have the better weapons, but the Indians nearly double the magic of the colonists. Maybe this time the history of the Americas will be very, very different.

The Battle for Turtle Island: Buffalo Wars is actually two books in one. It has the core rules for The Battle for Turtle Island RPG, which will be a series of books featuring the different parts of the Americas, and it also has the Buffalo Wars supplement which looks at the battles for the plains.

You can choose to be a Cavalry Soldier, an Arapahoe Medicine Man, a Colonist Trapper, an Apache Warrior, or any number of other classes, and your character can choose to change classes as they advance.

This book contains, the character classes, the special abilities for each Indian tribe, the goods, the spells, and much more. The only other thing you'll need to play is some dice and a vivid imagination.

153033.name: Adventurer's Handbook: Supplementary Rulebook I
153033.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every adventurer about to go out into the world to make a name for himself needs something to help in the quest for greatness. This handbook will help you in that endeavor. Inside you will find new and unique descriptions for many things to liven up your d20 gaming experience. Among the things offered to you in this first publication of the Creatures & Chaos line are:

9 new races, including a slew of new half-breeds
4 new and interesting player classes.
2 alternate version player classes.
Many new spells and a few new schools of interest.
New equipment, weapons, and armor to fill your backpack or saddlebag.
4 prestige Classes that will amaze you.
3 new NPC classes for the Campaign Master at heart
And much more in this 140+ page volume...




Don't go out into the adventuring world ill-equipped. Grab your Adventurer's Handbook and trek out into the unknown prepared.

As a bonus for buyers of our print version you will receive another 9 pages of added material.

153034.name: Deadly Encounters: Astray in the Woodlands
153034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Astray in the Woodlands is the first adventure module in the Larrgn Steelehart's Deadly Encounters series for Creatures & Chaos.

Traveling along the weed encroached road we saw a hunched shadow up ahead. The shadow didn't move - thinking an ambush imminent we drew our blades and notched arrows. As the horses trotted nearer, the sounds of sobbing and crying were heard. Hiding in the shadows nearby was a dark silhouette. Renwald silently stepped-down from his horse and cautiously sidestepped the twigs and branches as not to make a sound, while we trained our arrows in his direction. Sword drawn, Renwald arched around the tree. Behind the tree was a small human child crying, his knees tucked under his chin.

Is the child a sign of impending doom? Lost due to war or monster? Only one way to find out.....

Astray in the Woodlands is a supplemental adventure for a band of four adventurers of 6th to 8th-level. It can take place between campaign adventures, or as a small insert into a longer campaign adventure.

153035.name: Deadly Encounters: In a Manor of Speaking
153035.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is the master of the house in?

Over two hundred cycles ago in a remote town, a lord and his family mysteriously died in their manor. At least, that's how the story goes. The only thing known for certain is that one day they entered the estate, and they simply never came out.
Ever since then, strange noises coming from the old estate have been heard by the inhabitants of Daroksville. The natural conclusion was that the house is haunted.
Rumors of the unspeakable horrors wandering the halls have kept most people away, but more recent rumors of infinite riches have drawn several adventuring groups, as well as many a stranger claiming some relation to the dead Lord. None have ever emerged from the manor or been heard from again.
Recently, a young lad has arrived to claim ownership of the accursed abode. Before moving in, however, he would like to hire someone to do a little housecleaning.

"In a Manor of Speaking" is a short stand-alone side quest adventure for four 3rd-level characters, designed for use with the Creatures & Chaos and d20 line of products. It takes place in a 3-story manor filled with undead, puzzles, riddles, and traps. Characters must find clues and special items in order to advance through the manor and eventually escape its deadly curse. This adventure also introduces a new undead template: the Poltergeist.

153036.name: Deadly Encounters: Adventure Pack #1
153036.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure Pack #1 is the third adventure product in the Larrgn Steelehart's Deadly Encounters series for Creatures & Chaos. This product is a reprint of the first two adventures in the series for those customers that either want to own them in one volume or would like to own them in an actual print version. Each of these adventures has a belongs to a "things that go bump in the night" theme.

"Deadly Encounters: Astray in the Woodlands" by Daniel Deadmarsh
Your adventurers will happen upon a small child who holds a (possibly) deadly secret. Is the child a sign of impending doom? Lost due to war or monster? Only one way to find out...
Astray in the Woodlands is a supplemental adventure for a band of four adventurers of 6th to 8th-level. It can take place between campaign adventures, or as a small insert into a longer campaign adventure.

"Deadly Encounters: In a Manor of Speaking" by Craig Tidwell
A stranger claiming to be the heir to the long dead occupants of an estate that is rumored to be haunted wants to hire your adventurers to do a little "house cleaning". Do you take this person's offer in hopes of finding riches and adding to your reputation? Or do you go in boldly just for the sake of some thrills and adventure?
In a Manor of Speaking is a short stand-alone side quest adventure for four 3rd-level characters, designed for use with the Creatures & Choas and d20 line of products. It takes place in a 3-story manor filled with undead, puzzles, riddles, and traps. Characters must find clues and special items in order to advance through the manor and eventually escape its deadly curse. This adventure also introduces a new undead template: the Poltergeist.

153037.name: From the Laboratory of the Mad Wizard Shadmar
153037.description:
From publisher blurb:

This small collection of ten magical items are the result of the Mad Wizard Shadmar's insane attempt at power.
Each of these items has its own unique power, as well as its own individualistic history and curse. Along with a few of these items are adventure hooks to aide the Campaign Master in his endeavor to add these paraphernalia to his current game.
They are sure to add a different twist to your gaming session, and have your players cursing you the whole time.

Revision Notes: This product has been revised to address certain issues brought up by the reviewers.

Magical Item Statistics are now given
NPC listing for the Wizard himself is now given
All tables should be readable
New appendix featuring the Wizard's Tower

153038.description:
In Gone Viking, you want to become the richest viking in the clan, competing against the other players as you raid and pillage for valuable resources, call upon the Nordic gods to aid you with their divine powers, and do your best to avoid the nasty Jarl who always taxes the one Viking who returns home with the most plunder!

At its heart, Gone Viking is a trick-taking card game for 3-5 players. However, judge not! In this game you have to take the right tricks at strategic times to get yourself into the best position each round. With a double-edged-sword resource collection element, Gone Viking elevates itself as a uniquely competitive game, and one that reminds players of what it was like to be a viking raider.

In more detail, each round players receive a hand of cards, with the leader then swapping up to four cards for free. After trump is declared, all players can pay to swap cards. As players win tricks, they can plunder resource tokens that are used to win the game. During the trick-taking phase, players can add multiple cards together to increase their total and play viking god cards to use those special powers. The last standing viking god in a round provides an additional benefit to its owner, and the richest player in a round will find half his wealth taken by Jarl — so aim for second place in order to keep your goods.
153038.name: Gone Viking!
boardgamepodcastepisode: GenCon 2014 - The Flux Capacity
The Game of Crowd Funding Josh Bricker Interview 03-13-2014

153039.name: The Lost Caverns of Azgot
153039.description:
From the introduction:

While this adventure is not part of Old-School Adventures Old School Adventures Module VA1: Valley of the Five Fires, it has been designed to be used in conjunction with the setting it creates. Furthermore, its format allows use with almost any early edition of the original role-playing game (Oe, BX, 1e) or comparable retro-clone (e.g., S&W, LL), but may require some tweaking to match your chosen rules edition.

153040.name: Adventurer's Handbook 2nd Edition
153040.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every adventurer about to go out into the world to make his mark needs something to help in his quest for greatness. This campaign accessory will help you in that endeavor and has been updated from previous versions to fix errors and make gameplay easier. Inside this second revision of the Adventurer’s Handbook you will find updated descriptions for many things to liven up your d20 gaming experience. It has been edited and revamped from top to bottom to adhere to d20 3.5 rules more efficiently. Among the entries offered to you are:

Many races, including a slew of new half-breeds
Updated and interesting player classes
Tons of updated spells and a few new schools of interest
Equipment, weapons, and armor to fill your backpack
Prestige Classes that will amaze you
NPC classes for the Campaign Master at heart
And much more in this 150+ page volume...




Don’t go out into the adventuring world ill-equipped. Grab your Adventurer’s Handbook and trek out into the unknown prepared.

User note: This is a revised and rebranded version of Adventurer's Handbook: Supplementary Rulebook I.

153041.name: Outcastia Campaign Sourcebook Book I: World Tour
153041.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outcastia…
A land filled with mystery, adventure, danger, and....dragons! The history of Outcastia has been obscured by its legend and by the humans that talk of it. No matter what is said one thing is always consistent in any story that humans preach of this land, it is a remarkable country. Within this book you now hold you will read the truths and myths associated with one of the most powerful and alluring places in the realm. You will read of its origins and its heroes. Its gods and its monsters. Its people and its cities. You will no longer be in darkness about this country that most refer to as “The Land of Dragons”.

In World Tour, the first book in the Outcastia Campaign Setting 5th Edition, you will be taking a virtual walkabout through the world of Tærra-Söl and learning all that is needed to be a productive citizen therein from this 300+ page Tome:

Visit the legendary country of Outcastia and walk through the megatropolis of Dragon’s Den while immersing yourself in its diversity or visit the enchanting beauty of the Everlast Forest to partake in the festivities of its elven caretakers.
Sail to the Isles of the Winds to run free with its centaurian inhabitants.
Visit the forbidding city of Nightwatch that stands guard over the sinister Black Forest. But don’t get to close to those trees or your friends may never see you again… ever.
Learn the monetary systems of all the known countries on this side of the world. From Outcastia itself to its long standing nemesis, the country of Alagar. A country that is not fond of anyone or anything not human.
Learn how to tell time and act like one of the actual inhabitants of this realm.

153042.name: Outcastia Campaign Sourcebook Book II: Player's Guidebook
153042.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second book in the Outcastia Campaign Setting because one book was just too darn big!! This edition features classes, races, spells, equipment, and much more. It even sports an Outcastia specific character sheet which you can use for your games.

You’ve journeyed through the land in [Book I] and learned what you need to learn about the realm, now dive head first into the meat of this Campaign Setting with newly designed gaming elements that will help you to make your mark in the “Land of Dragons”. This book includes:

Races both unique and familiar. Eight races to choose from with subraces for most for a total of 28 choices to add to your arsenal of races we’ve already given you in the AHB.
Classes to delight both the power player and the new gamer alike with 9 to choose from and even a new NPC class for your CM.
Prestige Classes for those that want to break away from the norm after a bit of hard work and specialize in something specific. 20+ PrCs to choose from!!
Three new magic domains for the spellcaster inside of you with loads of new spells.
As well as new skills, feats, and equipment.




With this book you will have everything you need to play in the realm of Outcastia (and beyond). Even CMs will have most everything they will need…for now.

So what are you waiting for? Grab some paper and pencils. Bring out that dice. Rev up your imagination and travel to a land of magic and mayhem. Of honor and betrayal. Of adversity and adventure! Your journey awaits, if you have the nerve…

153043.name: Outcastia Campaign Sourcebook Book III: Campaign Master's Manual
153043.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Book III of the Outcastia Campaign Setting for the d20 System. You’ve journeyed through the land in World Tour and learned what you need to know about the realm, you dove into the meat of the Setting with newly designed gaming elements that help you make your mark in the “Land of Dragons” with the Player’s Guidebook, now it is time for you to delve into creating your own games as the Campaign Master™ with Book III: The Campaign Master’s Manual. This book includes:

In depth NPCs to add to your games to both strengthen them and to freshen them up.
Learn about the Secret Societies that inhabit the land that only those in the know have even gleaned.
An array of magical items from the mundane to the wondrous!
A sampling of monsters unique to Outcastia to wet your appetite before the release of [The Tome of Terrors].
An introduction into the religious pantheons of the world to help you get started before Divine Aspirations hits the shelves.
And more.




With this book you will have everything you need to run a campaign in the realm of Outcastia (and beyond). Everything you need is included.

So what are you waiting for? Grab some paper and pencils. Bring out that dice. Rev up your imagination and travel to a land of magic and mayhem. Of honor and betrayal. Of adversity and adventure! Your journey awaits, if you have the nerve…

153044.name: Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle
153044.description:
User Summary

The Golden Turtle is a traditional point and click adventure. Set in the Caribbean, it's a pirates adventure written by Steve Ince, known for his contribution to the Broken Sword adventure games.

Captain Morgane: The Golden Turtle is about the young girl Morgane who dreams about a great life as a pirate. She starts a quest for the legendary Golden Turtle. The journey takes her to the most gorgeous places in the Caribbean.

Apart from the main story line there are a number of optional missions and mini games. The game is in 3rd person view.

153045.name: From the Laboratory of the Mad Wizard Shadmar (Revision 2)
153045.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the realm of magic there are items that are created for both good and evil. At times, whether it is due to a degree of ineptness or just pure greed the outcome of some of these items are not quite what was intended. These items are considered to be cursed.

This collection of magical items is the continuing legacy of the Mad Wizard Shadmar. Shadmar was both full of greed with a lust for power and slightly insane. Whether it was because of the magical power he possessed or because of something genetic no one knows for sure.

Each of these items has its own unique power, as well as its own individualistic history and curse. These items also include adventure hooks to aide the Campaign Master in his endeavor to add these paraphernalia to his current game. They are sure to add a different twist to your game, and have your players cursing you the whole time.

Revision 2 has been updated to include adventure hooks, item creation costs, and other pertinent data to make it easier for CMs to add them to their gameplay.

153046.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Lou Promo
153046.description:
The first promo in the Kerubim series of mini-figs for the game Krosmaster Arena.

Available in French Flunch restaurants from december 2013 till January 2014.

This was also the streched goal number 8 in the Kickstart Krosmaster Frigost campain.

Story: (from card)
Treasure hunter, detective, baker: she's done it all! As well as being an independent woman, Lou is a true adventurer! And Kreub Crepin isn't the only one to like her feisty ways... because Indie Thikovit is also desperate to woo the lovely Ouginak... The two of them would go to the end of the earth just for a kiss from her! But will either of the dogged rivals ever manage to tame her wild side?

153047.name: Tome of Terrors
153047.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to your nightmares…

This book contains the terrors and creatures from the land of Outcastia and surrounding areas, from the revered adamantite dragons to the unusual wailing parchment, from the mighty meteor golem to the hideous digger ghoul, from the reclusive sponagledragon to the grotesque hill behemoth. You will find creatures to challenge, assist, and confound almost any adventuring party. With challenge ratings that range from 1/16 to 43, nearly every player and Campaign Manager alike can be appeased. Also included are the descriptions of all player character races allowed in the Outcastia campaign world (though individual CMs may allow even stranger PC races). Find inside a new template for half-breeds of any two races. Want to play a half-dwarf, half-elf? Voila: the Ulf. Want to play a half-minotaur, half-merfolk? The template tells you how to make your character.

As an added feature the descriptions also give the geographic (or game centric) location of each creature. Not sure if the monster fits into the game world or area of the OCS you want to place it? No problem, it’s all in the description to make it easier. Of course, this is optional but we hope it helps those that want to keep their world “canon”.

With over 100 monstrosities, this manual is essential for any CM who wants to throw some danger at their group. Most of these entries are newly created monsters, just for this book. Spice up your game with great adversaries to combat or even new player character races. Just be warned, once you peruse the contents of this book you may not be able to stuff the denizens back into their proper place…

153048.name: Templates of Terrors
153048.description:
From publisher blurb:

Templates of Terrors is a companion to the monster book, Tome of Terrors. These SIX templates will allow players and Campaign Masters alike the ability to create unique variations of some of the creatures found in the Core Rules. It should also make "rolling up" a character of this kind slightly faster.

153049.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 204 - 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit

153050.name: Humans
153050.description:
From publisher blurb:

The NPC classes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game are an often overlooked treasure for gamemasters. This collection of 100 block stats features all 5 NPC classes (Adept, Aristocrat, Commoner, Expert, and Warrior), level 1 through 20, along with suggestions on variants, ideas for using them in your own game, and even how to use them as player character classes for a "lite" game!

153051.name: Caves of Sydwall
153051.description:
from the Introduction:
Caves of Sydwall is an AD&D 2nd Edition compatible adventure designed for 4-6 characters of levels 7–9 (average 40 total levels).

from the back cover:
Years ago, an evil wizard settled down in a complex of caves, far away from the town where he was exiled. Soon after, the adventurers started coming, thanks to an old sage and his book. For most, it was the promise of treasure. For some, it was a mission. For others, it was a sacred place.

None ever returned.

Now, it has fallen upon you to journey to the caves, to discover what lies within. Your reasons are your own, but despite the peril, you and your friends set off towards the Tharuss Hills, and the... Caves of Sydwall

153052.name: Regime
153052.description:
You are diplomats sent to the turbulent nation of REGIME to form an alliance with their leadership. Popular uprisings are a common occurrence, so be careful with whom you form an alliance!

To win, you must manage your allegiances, oust unpopular factions, and keep your constituency happy!

153053.name: TV Game Show Greats
153053.description:
Bring the family game show favourites straight to your living room! Classic family fun from The Price is Right and Play Your Cards Right to Blockbusters and Family Fortunes. Play each separately or choose to move from show to show (ala Ant & Dec/Vernon Kay's Game Show Marathon) after each round using 6 different game boards and question cards. Look out for the well-known sounds such as the famous "eahh ehhh!" sound buzzer for Family Fortunes, or the honeycombs board for Blockbusters.

Box Contains:


1 x double sided board game
2 x dice
6 x player pieces
1 x sand timer (30 seconds)
120 x Blockbuster hexagon titles
2 x decks of Family Fortunes Cards
2 x decks of The Price is Right Cards
1 x set of large playing cards
Exclusive TV Game Show Greats paper money donations E1000, E500, E100, E50, E10, E5, E1
'UH UH' electronic sound buzzer
2 x pencils with rubber ends
18 page full colour instruction booklet

153054.name: Fabula Regnum
153054.description:
Eres un rey en una época de leyendas. Forja tu reino en un mundo de dragones, magia y brujería. no será fácil: otros reyes tiene la misma ambición. ¿Te atreves a ser parte de la leyenda?

You are a king in a time of legends. Forge your kingdom in a world of dragons, magic and sorcery. It won't be easy: other kings have the same ambition. Would you dare to be part of the legend?

Each turn, players reveal cards from the Fabula Deck. Gold, treasure, castle parts, troops to create an army, allies and threats may appear, creating an storytelling game. Each time you play, the fabulous tale will change.
Main objetive is to complete your Castle and get the Princess. There are several ways to achieve this and the ending of the tale depends on yours!

It also includes advanced game rules with a more complete combat system and the Black King being automatically controlled willing to defeat the other Kings.

153055.name: Ability Score
153055.description:
User summary:

Ability Score is the core rules of the RPG of the same name, which fit on one side of one page. The whole game is based on ability scores, with genre and other setting elements being represented by adding and subtracting ability scores.

153056.name: War of Turkish Liberation
153056.description:
War of Turkish Liberation (Türk Kurtulus Savasi) is a simulation of the War between Turkish Nationalist forces, led by Mustafa Kemal "Ataturk" against Greek, Armenian, and assorted Imperialist forces.

Game begins the spring of 1920, when the Greek forces launched a major offensive to conquer Asia Minor.

The game pits the Imperialist player (Armenians, Georgians, Azerbaijan, Greeks, etc.) against the Revolutionary player (Turkish Nationalists, Bolsheviks) from 1920 to 1922.

The map shows Anatolia and the Caucasus and adjacent areas.

To be published in Strategy & Tactics #309 in 2017.

153057.name: Chaos Realms: The Fight for Humanity Has Begun
153057.description:
From "Overview" page of website:


THE BASICS

Here is a quick overview on some of the things you will encounter while playing Chaos Realms. Most of these will be familiar to role players, although some of the game mechanics may be a little different than you might be used to.

THE CHAOS LORD

When playing Chaos Realms, you are participating in a dark and dangerous interactive story where players take on the roles of unique characters, called avatars. One player may serve as the Chaos Lord, a combination director, narrator and referee. The Chaos Lord’s role is to describe scenarios, ask the players what their characters want to do and then resolve these situations according to the rules of the game.

Other duties of the CL include setting up each scene, moving the story along, and take on the roles of all the monsters, demons and non-player characters that the player’s avatars encounter during each adventure. It is important that the CL read through all sections of this book so that she may have an idea of where to find things once the horrors begin.

NOTE: The Chaos Lord has the final say in all matters!

AVATARS

All players, other than the CL will take on the role of an avatar – a character you, the other players, and the CL help to create. You create your avatar with the help of the game rules, according to your own vision for the type of character you want to play and according to the adventure presented by the CL.

During game play your character will likely participate in several adventures or quests and as a result will gain experience points for each skill he or she may use which will help him or her to become more skilled.

SKILLS

Each action during game play requires the use of one skill or another, sometimes more than one skill at once. To determine the success or failure of a skill, the player may be required to roll one or more dice, which is determined by the character’s rank in that skill and is rolled against a difficulty rating. Each skill has a predefined difficulty rating, which the player must roll against to successfully use the skill.

For example, Nazron – a genetically enhanced Street Samurai, has Bladed Weapons +3 and a Short Sword with a difficulty rating of 5. This means that during combat, Nazron will be able to roll 3d6 when using a bladed weapon and his short sword requires that he roll at a 5. He rolls 3d6 and gets a 2, 5 and 1, since one of the die is equal to or higher than 5 he can, therefore, use the weapon successfully to slice and dice his opponents.

MAGIC

Magic is used the same as skills, each spell is ranked according to the skill level of the character and has a difficulty rating, which the player must roll against to determine the success or failure of the spell. Some spells are instantaneous, while other spells require complex rituals that may take several combat turns to cast. There are area effects spells, targeted spells and buff spells as well as magical items, such as weapons and armor.

DICE

When performing an action you may have to make a dice roll to determine the level of success or failure of said action. Throughout this manual, the rules abbreviate dice rolls with phrases like 3d6+1, which means three six-sided dice plus 1 (which generates a number between 4 and 19). In this method, the first number represent the number of dice to roll (all of which are added up), the number after the “d” lets you know what type of dice to use, and any number after this represents the quantity to be added or subtracted from the result.

GAME PLAY

This overview will cover some of the basics a playing Chaos Realms. Other sections on this website will expand upon these basic concepts. It is not important to memorize the contents of this section to play the game, as to do so will surely cause madness and insanity. Use this book merely as a reference during play and have fun.

ROLLING DICE

Most dice rolls will be against a Difficulty Check, which determines the difficulty of the action the character wishes to accomplish. To do this, roll all the dice attributed to the relevant skill, add any situational or environmental modifiers and try to get a result that is equal to or greater than the DC of the desired action.

NOTE: Not all actions require a die roll.

Roll dice during combat, or scenarios in which the success of an action may become more difficult. However, if there is a situation in which roll-play can determine the outcome, then dice rolls are not necessary. Also, the Chaos Lord should reward those who rollplay out situations by giving them extra experience points.

ADDING MODIFIERS

When rolling dice to determine the outcome of certain actions you may be required to add or subtract one or more modifiers to your die roll. Modifiers may result from situational circumstances, environmental factors or faulty equipment.

GAINING EXPERIENCE

Experience (XP) is gained by the use of skills, defeating opponents and by completing quests. Except for XP earned from completing quests, experience earned go towards the skill in which the character used to earn the experience points. Therefore to become more skilled, you must simply use your skills more. Practice makes perfect.

As mentioned above, you can also earn additional XP by successfully completing missions, quests and campaigns. Each mission, or campaign, has a ranking between 1 and 6 (1 being the easiest and 6 being the most difficult quest imaginable). XP earned by successfully completing quests can be applied to any skill or attribute.

CHARACTER ACTIONS

Just as in real life, characters can try to do pretty much anything you can imagine. As long as the action fits the scenario and the CL allows, it can be done.

Characters can accomplish these actions by making ability or skill checks using one or more d6, depending on their skill ranking and adding any attribute, situational or environmental modifiers.

153058.name: Adventures Under the Laughing Moon Role-Playing Game
153058.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventures Under the Laughing Moon is a fantasy role-playing game that introduces players to the world of Mythren where magic and danger are a part of everyday life. Prophecies warn of magical persecution and the rise of ancient powers. Shadows of evil threaten the lands as a call for heroes is sounded.

A story-based, character driven RPG, this is a great introductory game for anyone new to the RPG scene, or veteran gamers looking for something new. Similar in style to other story-based games like D&D, Laughing Moon players have a variety of skills that help define their characters without limiting them to a single "class."

Skills, magic, occupations and creature concepts are very open for player input. This is a story based game designed to accompany the Laughing Moon Chronicles fantasy series. It's a quick and easy adventure setting for new players with a system designed to support a story created by the game master.

Players are able to create characters of their own and become a part of the epic story found in the fantasy series, The Laughing Moon Chronicles. Enter a world of ancient mystery, and a system of magic that lures sorcerers toward forbidden power.

Seek items of power, battle creatures of darkness and uncover the mysteries beneath the Laughing Moon in this tabletop role-playing game!

153059.name: Book of Arcane Spells
153059.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Book of Arcane Spells is a must have supplement for all Game Masters and players who choose to play a magic user. Packed with new rules, spells, and background, this book is certain to add a sense of magic and wonder to your campaign setting. Some of the included magic will be familiar to D&D style players, while other spells and magic are entirely unique to the Laughing Moon setting. The spells included within the book range in power, usage, and complexity. Additionally, the Book of Arcane Spells includes a section on Poisons, Herbs, and Magical Concoctions that will further enhance not only spell casters, but any player with Herbalism, Poison Handling, or Potion Making skills. Bring new magic into your Laughing Moon game with this new supplement!

153060.name: Book of Divine Powers
153060.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Book of Divine Powers is THE definitive guide to the priestly class in Adventures Under the Laughing Moon. Game Masters will be pleased to discover that each god of Mythren is described here in detail, including their history and impact on the world. Players will now be able to fully embrace the priestly class with unique powers and abilities bestowed by individual gods. What this means is that a priest of healing and a Holy Knight of justice may both be deemed “priests,” but will see entirely different game play. Gods of light, and gods of darkness are all here for GM and player perusal. Additionally, learn about the role of all the immortal races in the world Under the Laughing Moon as gods, titans, angels and more are revealed. Have a little faith in all your adventures with this supplement to the Laughing Moon core rule book.

153061.name: The Ragged Man (Special Edition)
153061.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ragged Man is the first stand-alone adventure for the Laughing Moon tabletop role-playing game, and is designed to be both a supplement and an expansion. The adventure is written with all player types in mind. Whether this be a first-time player, or an experienced veteran gamer, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

The adventure opens with the player characters trapped in a gypsy camp, surrounded by a mysterious bank of fog. During the night they hear the legend of the ragged man, as told by one of the gypsies and discover the tragic origins of this tale. For centuries the Ragged Man, a vengeful spirit that appears in scarecrow form, has haunted these lands in a mindless search for his lost children. The adventure takes players on a chase to save the gypsy camp by battling hideous creatures that are part man, part raven, a coven of vampires known as the Sullen Ones, a treacherous enemy masquerading as a friend, minions of the powerful and mysterious Raven Duchess, and the Ragged Man himself.

Designed for 2-6 players, The Ragged Man adventure takes players deep into the world under the Laughing Moon where a desperate rescue mission pits them against nightmare creatures in a race against time.

A stand-alone expansion to accompany the Adventures Under the Laughing Moon tabletop role-playing game, The Ragged Man is a blend of fantasy and horror that allows the players to determine the outcome of the story.

This SPECIAL EDITION includes 6 fully equipped unique player characters packed with skills, abilities, and items to take on the adventure.

153062.name: Game Master Cheat Sheet
153062.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Laughing Moon Game Master’s Screen includes all of the “must have” charts and tables from the Adventures Under a Laughing Moon core rulebook for a GM’s quick reference during game play. The interior of this GM screen features custom artwork of heroes within the Laughing Moon Game. The outer panels feature additional artwork from the Laughing Moon Chronicles.

Print the sheets to create your own five-paneled GM Screen, or keep for easy electronic access. Either way you go, this is the perfect companion piece for any Laughing Moon Game Master.

153063.name: Quot
153063.description:
The abstract strategy game Quot has one simple rule: you must control surrounding spaces to claim new ones.

The game starts by using 13 of the 20 unique two-sided mats to construct the board. You will never play the same game twice, so you will always be challenged to adapt your strategy to the layout of the board.

Each board space displays a value from zero to four. This value indicates how many adjacent spaces you must control to claim that space. Take turns competing with your opponent to take spaces that allow new moves while also limiting your opponent's options.

Quot encourages players to anticipate their opponent's moves and develop a strategy to secure the largest area as possible. If you claim enough space to run your opponent out of possible moves, you win!

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
153064.description: Good Cop Bad Cop is a 52 card hidden identity, deduction game where each player takes on the role of a law enforcement officer in a corrupt district. Players must investigate others to figure out who is on their side, grab one of the 2-3 guns on the table, and shoot the opposing leader to win the game.

153065.description:
In Linko! (a.k.a. Abluxxen), you take turns playing number cards, and the more cards of the same number you play, the better as cards score points at the end of the game. If someone else plays the same amount of cards with a higher number, however, your cards get nicked! Stealing cards can be good, but if you can't use them later, and end the game with cards in hand, they'll cost you points.

In more detail, the deck contains 104 number cards (1-13 x8) and five joker cards. Each player starts with a hand of 13 cards, and six cards are laid face-up next to the deck. On a turn, a player lays down one or more cards of the same value, adding jokers if desired; if she already has cards on the table, she lays these cards so that previously played cards are still visible. If any opponent has most recently played the same number of cards and those cards are of a lower value, then the active player "abluxxes" those opponents — that is, the active player can take the abluxxed cards into her hand and the opponent then draws the same number of cards, either from the display or the deck; if she doesn't take these cards in hand, then the opponent either returns these cards to his hand or discards them and draws that many cards. Refill the display only after someone finishes drawing cards. (Jokers can be played on their own, and they are considered to be higher than all values.)

As soon as the deck runs out of cards or a player has no cards in hand, the game ends immediately, even if the player would normally abluxx an opponent. Each player scores one point for each card on the table in front of him, then loses one point for each card in hand. Whoever has the highest score wins. If players wish, they can play multiple rounds and sum their scores over the rounds to determine a winner.

153066.name: President Wars: Battle Through The Centuries
153066.description:
President Wars is a card and dice game that takes the traditional game of war and
transforms it into a battle of epic proportions. The deck contains every president from
George Washington to Barack Obama. Each president is given a hit point value based
on real life statistics determined by time spent in office, popularity and war experience.
On every battle card we added facts about each president. Our country's complete
leadership over the past 200+ years packed into one game.

This game is easy to learn and fun for all ages young old and with so many card
combinations, this game has unlimited replay value and should never be the same
game twice. Each card represents a different time and era in American history

Rules of War

2 Player

Each player chooses their favorite die- Republican, Democrat or Independent (red, white or blue)

Shuffle the deck and deal each player 22 cards. -Do not look at them- Place them in a pile face down in front of you. Both players turn over the top card on their pile and battle. If your card wins the battle you place it on the bottom of your pile for future use and if your card loses you put it in a separate pile, this card is no longer playable. A player wins when they successfully defeat their opponent's entire army.

1 player

Choose between 1 and 6 cards from the deck either by random or by choice and these will be your battle cards. Play through the deck to see how many presidents you can eliminate before you are taken out. Keep track of your score on score pad.

Rules of Battle

Each player rolls their die at the same time. The player who rolls the higher number gets the strike. The damage= difference in dice. Opponent then must subtract it from their battle card. The battle is over when one card loses all their hit points or an eagle is rolled.

Example - If player 1 rolls a (7) player and player 2 rolls a (1)......Then player 2 must subtract 6 from their card.

Battle Dice- 10 Sided- Numbered 2-9 with 2 symbols

Eagle- If you roll an eagle, you steal your player's card and place it on the bottom of your pile.

Shield- If you roll a shield you defend your opponent's attack and they must subtract their total roll from their battle card

153067.name: Wild Guess?
153067.description:
Wild Guess? is a quick and easy game, where two contestants try to guess which animal their opponent has picked from the animal cards by asking questions that can be answered with yes or no. For example: Can your animal fly? Does it have 4 legs?

Animal cards can also be used as an animal memory game.

153068.name: Kill Code
153068.description:
Somewhere out in space, a military research station was recently damaged by a storm. While the damage and debris could be repaired, to the researchers' horror a retired military weapon residing in storage, an armored drone programmed only for wiping out a population, was reactivated by a malfunction and began to brutally slaughter them one by one.

As the team of surviving scientists, brave and explore the hallways of the facility, avoid the drone, and lead the survivor bearing the drone's "Kill Code" device to the terminal in order to begin the deactivation process and survive until repair crews can reach the station. As the drone, figure out which of the survivors is carrying the Kill Code device, then viciously hunt them down...

rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
153069.name: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: Green Box (Advanced Rules)
rpgitemversion: Aventuras en la Marca del Este: La Caja Verde
153069.description:
publisher blurb

Aventuras en la Marca del Este (Adventures in the East Mark) was born in the minds of the creators of the eponymous blog as a project that returns to the most rabid present the style of the great glories of RPGs. An undertaking of this magnitude could only be addressed from an absolute dedication and utmost care of every detail, and so demonstrate their exquisite illustrations and fantastic layout. And this is not just words, just take a look at the material that gradually have been published on his blog, to the delight of all who await the arrival of the game.

The game is published by Holocubierta Ediciones, a spanish RPG publisher founded on October 2.010.

The box includes the advanced rules for the game, character sheets for every character classes and a Spell compendium.

153071.name: Hoppsan
153071.description: Each player gets a deck of picture cards. The cards are laid picture down a few meters/feet away from the game board. Then one of the players spins the spinner. The spinner shows the cards the players need to find, and the way the players have to move to their cards. Then the players turn their cards up one by one, and the first one to find the card, shouts "Found it!" This card is placed on the game board, and the next player spins the spinner. The first person who finds enough cards, wins.

153072.name: Empires Mod
153072.description:
Empires, the award-winning Half-Life 2 mod, combines the best of the first person shooter and real-time strategy genres. Fight as either the Northern Faction, remnants of the fallen nation of Jekotia, or as the imperial Brenodi Empire.

Choose your commander wisely and fight with up to 64 players for resources to power your army and fund your research into ever more deadly weapons, abilities and vehicles.

Source: The Developer Website.

153073.description:
The DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Starfire oversized hero card was initially available as a promotional card for preordering Cryptozoic Entertainment's DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Heroes Unite. This card can be mixed with any of the other hero cards in the game to give players one more choice when choosing heroes before starting to play.

As with every other hero, Starfire grants a special ability to the player, which in this case is: "Once during each of your turns, if there are no Super Powers in the Line-Up, draw a card."
153073.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Starfire
boardgameexpansion: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Heroes Unite

153074.description: Produced mid-1980's as a fund raiser for Junior Achievement in the Portland, Maine area. Instead of streets, local businesses were featured with the smallest being Mr. Potato (a baked potato and fixings fast food restaurant at the Maine Mall food court) and the largest being Unum (a large insurance company). The game also substituted 'customers' and 'groups of customers' for the houses and hotels used in the normal version of the game.
153074.name: Maineopoly

153075.description:
From the publisher's site:

This is our flagship product as Moon Design Publications launches the 3rd Age of Glorantha. The huge success of our Kickstarter forced us to break it into two hardcover books. And when you get it, you get both books. It details all the major places in Glorantha, all the cultures. That’s everything you need to run a campaign in any part of the world!

This the sister product to the Argan Argar Atlas. You will want both.

The Guide to Glorantha is coming as soon as our Mostali craftsmen can complete it.

153077.description: Time for the cockroaches to hit the dance floor in Kakerlakentanz. Players take turns playing their dance cards, then making the right — or precisely the wrong — dance moves and sounds while naming the style of dance.
153077.name: Kakerlakentanz
