With A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2012, you’ll have all the options to make exactly the character you want.

And what’s more, you don’t have to search through dozens of articles to find it. Everything has been collected, archived, and gathered in an organized fashion, making finding what you’re looking for a breeze, including an extensive network of built-in links within the .pdf itself, which allow you to go straight from a spell list or magic item price table to the thing you’re looking at, without even needing to use the also thoroughly-prepared bookmarks.

153358.name: A Necromancer's Almanac: 2013
153358.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Year in the Making…Again!

A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2012 was a massive tome of character options of every sort, collected from the Necromancers of the Northwest website over the course of an entire year, and arranged in a simple, easy to use fashion to make all of its extensive content much more accessible at the gaming table.

It was such a success that we’re back again with another edition, creatively titled A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2013. This book is just as jam-packed as the last, with over fifty new archetypes, along with two new base classes and four new prestige classes. It also boasts well over 200 new feats, and a smattering of new traits. And don’t forget the massive collection of nearly 150 new magic items, or the nearly 50 pages of all new spells.

A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2013 is a compilation of all the material produced in 2013 for Necromancers of the Northwest’s popular article lines Best in Class, Extraordinary Feats, Magic Market, and Obscure Arcana. Clocking in at 200 pages, it’s not hard to believe that this book was a full year in the making.

Inside, you’ll find exciting and experimental new spells, which toy with taking magic in strange and unusual directions. You’ll find a feat for just about every occasion, and a magic item for virtually any need, plus dozens of in-depth archetypes for lots of exciting and evocative staples of the fantasy genre. With A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2013, you’ll have all the options to make exactly the character you want.

And what’s more, you don’t have to search through dozens of articles to find it. Everything has been collected, archived, and gathered in an organized fashion, making finding what you’re looking for a breeze.

153359.name: World Wonders Supplemental Volume 3: Structures
153359.description:
From publisher blurb:

Structures provide a purpose. They may aid a city in its time of need, or provide a place to communicate with the outside world. Whatever the reason, they have many uses and many possible variations, some of which of featured here.

This is a supplement for “World Wonders” by Ennead Games. This volume focuses on structures – a form of building or construction that serve a purpose other (or addition) to being a place for business or residence.

Example structures include:

Levee (minor) - for helping when floods occur
Aerial Dock(major) - A multi-purpose tower that can help with airial based commerce and more
The Beacon - The ultimate in long range fast, simple communication short of arcane or divine methods

153360.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Set the pizza aside, collect your weapons, and get ready to go as Splinter and his ninjas are here!

In Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Einsatz im Shellraiser, each player needs to collect Master Splinter, April O'Neil, and a complete set of turtles as quickly as possible in order to oppose the chosen villain. Whoever first gets his team together wins the round — but shuffle the cards quickly and prepare for the next round because the villains keep coming...
153360.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Einsatz im Shellraiser

153361.name: Four Fronts
153361.description:
Four Fronts is a Chess variant for 2, 3, or four players, individually or in pairs. Each player has 12 pieces: 6 pawns, 1 each of the king, queen, knight, rook, and bishop, and a "prince" piece that is a hybrid of a bishop and a rook. The board is an ordinary 8x8 black and white chessboard, but extended along each of four sides for the player's starting fields. Along each 8-square side of the board is another six squares, then another four squares, then two, all of them centered. The overall shape of the board then can be seen as a square with jagged edges, and with its four corners highlighted in colors to match the players' pieces. The colored squares are the starting positions for each player.

The game's rules of movement, capture, and winning conditions appear to be otherwise the same as in Chess.

153362.name: Big Trouble in Little Haiti
153362.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Miami neighborhood known as Little Haiti has suffered from a steady decline over the past several years. Gang warfare has claimed the lives of dozens of residents of the neighborhood. Drug abuse and alcoholism are rampant problems. Over the last two decades the neighborhood has gone from being a vibrant immigrant community to a bad part of town, considered a criminal haven by outsiders. The law-abiding residents of Little Haiti have lived in fear of the criminals that have claimed their streets. Local government and law enforcement seem to have little interest in cleaning up this forsaken part of town, and the status quo has been bleak for some time.

In recent weeks, things seem to be turning around for Little Haiti. The crime rate saw a brief but brutal spike before dropping drastically. The shadier elements of the neighborhood are seen far less frequently and the general populace in the area seem to be more relaxed and at ease, despite no additional involvement from law enforcement.

Rumors among those who know of the supernatural indicate that a powerful houngan has declared Little Haiti to be his protectorate. While this houngan is said to be loved by the people, some whisper that he has wrestled the neighborhood from the clutches of criminals by utilizing mystical means to surpass their brutality. Some accuse him of acting as judge, jury and executioner, with no regard for any authority but his own and that of the lwa.

Big Trouble in Little Haiti can serve as an introductory story for Contagion Second Edition. Certain elements of the setting are explored and expanded upon in this story seed, including expanded examples of Spirits and a gritty, street-level look at the world of Contagion. Due to the nature of the events in Big Trouble in Little Haiti, characters from virtually any background or faction could become caught up in the action. The materials presented in Big Trouble in Little Haiti are designed with standard starting characters in mind, but with a little number juggling by the Gamemaster, the antagonists could be scaled up or down in power to adequately challenge characters of any experience level.

Big Trouble in Little Haiti includes:

7 new NPCs
5 new Spirits
3 new Spells
1 new Feat

153363.name: Purgatorio
153363.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place to live...

...and a horrific place to die.

Purgatorio is a sourcebook that describes the existence of ghosts and the realm of Purgatory, which they inhabit. A battleground in the War between Heaven and Hell, angels of the Gregori and Demons of the Chammadi use Purgatory as a grounds for hunting and recruiting those souls who have, for whatever reason, refused to go on to their final fate.

Natives of Purgatory, such as the incomprehensible Rueda del Fuego, hunt ghosts relentlessly. Magi of the Council of Tears seek to harvest the power of ghosts, some going so far as to perform the blasphemous rituals of Lichdom to avoid death itself.

Psychics, with a bizarre connection to the forces and energies of Purgatory walk between the worlds of the living and the worlds of the dead, sometimes acting as emmisaries, other times acting as hunters.

Amid this nightmarish landscape ghosts strive to eke out an existence, survive the threats before them and handle the business they were unable to finish in life.

Purgatorio utilizes a modified version of the 3.5 OGL. All material can be easily adapted to your existing OGL game, however Purgatorio is designed to function within the world of the Contagion RPG.

Purgatorio includes:

A new Player Character race: Ghosts.
Rules for converting your existing character to a Ghost, as well as updated class abilities for characters who shuffle loose the mortal coil.
Thirteen new Advanced Classes.
Expanded rules for Psychics including a slew of psychic powers.
Seven Ghostly Power Trees: an entirely new set of powers for your Ghost PCs and NPCs
Fourteen new or updated feats dealing with psychics and Ghosts.
Nine new spells for dealing with Ghosts and Purgatory.
Six new Incorporeal creatures.
New rules for dealing with incorporeality.
Rules for rituals of Exorcism.
Expanded rules for Lichdom, including the rituals and benefits of the redesigned Lich.

153364.name: Player's Toolkit
153364.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place to live...

...fortunately there are tools to help you survive!

Player's Toolkit is a sourcebook that contains several optional resources for character creation, customization and advancement.

Player's Toolkit utilizes a modified version of the 3.5 OGL. All material can be easily adapted to your existing OGL game, however Player's Toolkit is designed to function within the world of the Contagion RPG.

Player's Toolkit includes:

Rules for Character Traits allowing deeper customization during character creation. Over thirty new traits!
Rules for Flaws, taking certain penalties to gain access to bonus feats. Over thirty flaws!
Three new Advanced Classes.
A new optional system for Pagan spellcasters.
New sample magic items.

153365.name: Servants of the Chammadi
153365.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell's Henchmen Chapter 2: Servants of the Chammadi features:

10 all-new Undead Hellspawn
Background of the Chammadi, demons of death




Inside this supplement you will find the following Hellspawn:

Annubians - humans who have been mummified.
Bilious Shamblers - walking corpses who have been mystically altered to use the bacteria that breaks down their own flesh as a weapon.
Carrion Hound - hunters made to track and hunt down the enemies of the infernal host.
The Forgotten - the embodiment of the frustration and rage of those that have been left behind.
Hybrid Zombie - an undead horror composed of a wide variety of fused human and animal appendages.
Patchwork Ghoul - freakish killers created from stitched together pieces of dozens of corpses.
Skeletal Plate - undead armor created by taking the entire skeleton of a human who reveled in battle during life and forging a suit of unliving armor from the bones.
Soul-Eater - flesh eating undead that can incorporate their victim’s abilities and memories into itself, growing more powerful as it feeds.
Vengeful Zombie - a creature who has returned from the grave on a mission of vengeance.
Zombie - A new spin on a classic undead critter.

153366.name: Servants of the Leviathans
153366.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell's Henchmen Chapter 3: Servants of the Leviathans features:

10 all-new Hellspawn including Aberrations, Plants and Vermin
Full color illustrations
Background of the Leviathans, demons of nature gone wrong




Inside this supplement you will find the following Hellspawn:

Bleeder Nurse - sadists created from the souls of medical providers and healers who took advantage of patients in their care.
Boerwurm- slow, methodical killers that chew through a victim's flesh, ultimately attacking the brain.
Flesh Gorger - vermin parasites that nest in a victim's body.
Fomorii - mutated brutes.
Painshackle - horrific aberrations who have barbed chains protruding from their flesh.
Polepsis - Parasitic vermin that drive those they infect to evil acts.
Pus Bloom - a monstrous flesh eating plant.
Skeeters - mutated mosquitos fed on a diet of rotting corpses.
Treebeast - man-eating trees that snatch their unsuspecting victims in the night.
Verdant Oasis - enormous plant creatures taking up an area comparable to a small city park. Often found in underpriviledged and crime-ridden areas, Verdant Oases are traps for the unsuspecting urban masses.

153367.name: This is the Town of Thieves
153367.description:
User summary:

A quick "jump out in time" card game for 3–4 players. Cards representing gentlemen thieves are wandering around the table, and players take turns either playing a new treasure on their thief, or bailing out and taking what they have. As cards can be played either face up and face down, jumping out in time is crucial. The last player gets everything that's left, which normally is good but can be devastating.

153368.description:
La Bataille de Paris 1814 (The Battle of Paris 1814) is a wargame on the last phase of the campaign in France in 1814. The coalition forces (Russian-Austrian-Prussian) must quickly seize the capital weakly defended to end the rule of Napoleon who stayed too long behind.

The game features two scenarios: the first scenario corresponds to the historical situation that saw low numbers of troops under Marmont and Mortier standing for honor, facing an enemy five times bigger and inflicting the highest losses of the campaign. The second scenario is hypothetical but historically plausible. If Napoleon had from March 2nd decided to follow the Allies to Paris and defeat them rather than trying to harass their supply lines.
153368.name: La Bataille de Paris 1814

153369.name: Servants of the Malphas
153369.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell's Henchmen Chapter 4: Servants of the Malphas features:

10 all-new Hellspawn including Constructs and Giants
Background of the Malphas, twisted demons with a sick sense of humor




Inside this supplement you will find the following Hellspawn:

Bellwitch - an evil old woman summoned through a mirror.
Bloodstone - the altar of a flase god, the Bloodstone demands sacrifices.
Breeder Troll - Horribly disfigured and incredibly amorous, Breeder trolls are addicted to men of all humanoid species and mate by force.
Burning Man - A 30 foot tall flaming animated wicker man.
Hellforge - A living Hellspawn factory, the Hellforge turns its victims into monsters.
Marconi's Revenge - A radio that instills paranoia and nudges its owner to commit evil.
Mist Giant - a creature that creates and distributes accursed magical items.
Poppit - children's toys possessed by murderous spirits...Wanna Play?
Razor Swarm - yes, it's what it sounds like.
Toll Troll- guardians created by the Malphas, Toll Trolls ask anyone who enters their domain to answer riddles three. Should the tresspasser fail, they face the wrath of the Toll Troll.




Like laughing at the expense of others? Want to torture your players with some truly sadistic Hellspawn? From evil children's toys to a darkly hilarious take on Burning Man, this supplement is chock full of twisted critters guaranteed to give you an evil chuckle.

153370.name: Servants of the Marchocia
153370.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell's Henchmen Chapter 5: Servants of the Marchocia features:

10 all-new Elemental Hellspawn
Background of the Marchocia, demons of destruction.




Inside this supplement you will find the following Hellspawn:

Arioch's Passing - fire elementals that supposedly created from the burning footprints that Archduke Arioch leaves when he treads upon the earth.
Earth Golem- ruthless killers with no capacity for compassion.
Frost Devil - creatures of cold that reflect the bitterness in man’s heart since the exile from Eden.
Hate Elemental - fire elementals that project hate into the minds of all near them.
Lady of the Mists - elementals tthat habitate in bogs and swamps, seeking unwary travelers who pass these remote areas under the cover of night.
Napalm Elemental - elementals that burn everything they touch with an undying flame.
Nymph - water elemental seductresses who have historically called to ships at sea in the hopes of seducing sailors into suicide.
The Pinch - an electricity elemental that attacks from power lines.
Smog Wisp - a sentient cloud of poisonous gas is most often found in areas of heavy air pollution.
Stormrider - elementals empowered with the ability to manipulate the weather.

153371.name: Servants of the Mastim
153371.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell's Henchmen Chapter 6: Servants of the Mastim features:

10 all-new Fey Hellspawn
Background of the Mastim, demons of twisted faith and false gods




Inside this supplement you will find the following Hellspawn:

Brownies - good natured and gentle creatures...so long as they are appeased.
Faith-Eater- cult leaders who siphon the personality and individuality of their followers to perpetuate their own existence.
Flora - A Mastim pawn worshipped as a goddess of plants and nature throughout the world.
John Hunter - an immortal false prophet who preaches self-worship.
Maya - Once a revered goddess, she is now driven mad with a burning need to seek revenge on the white man and drive him from the Pure Lands.
Odyne - a twisted Hellspawn that believes she is the mother of all monsters.
Pixies - terrible gossips who take advantage of unwary victims to gain secrets for their demonic masters.
Priestess of the Wild - a crafty Hellspawn who willingly serves the Mastim as a false avatar of the Goddess.
Sakpata - hailed throughout the African continent as a god of disease, Sakpata wanders through remote tribal communities seeking followers
Tezcatlipoca- Aztec god of wisdom and magic. He is willing to share his secrets...for a price.

153372.name: NichtLustig: Fäkalini
153372.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Fäkalini makes an appearance in the appropriately-named NichtLustig: Fäkalini. Who is Fäkalini, you ask? Not only is he an experienced plumber, but he's also a passionate magician, and after he finishes repairing a clogged toilet, he then performs one of his tricks.

In this dice game, players try to outdo one another by keeping good tiles for themselves, while leaving the poor tiles for others.

153373.name: Servants of the Ornians
153373.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell's Henchmen Chapter 7: Servants of the Ornians features:

10 all-new Outsider Hellspawn
Background of the Ornians, demon outcastes that beg for scraps from the other castes




Inside this supplement you will find the following Hellspawn:

Bud - false infants that take advantage of those who show them mercy.
Nightmare Walker - creatures that attack people in their dreams, spreading fear and discord.
Conceit - the concept of pride given flesh.
Devourer - the living embodiment of gluttony.
Lifethieves - greed in the flesh, with a dark twist.
Punishers - wrath personified.
Sirens - the embodiment of lust.
Layabouts - sloth given form.
Magepie - a monstrous creature created to steal magic back from humans.
Transmuted - stealth Hellspawn that hide their true nature within a human form.

153374.name: It Rolls Downhill
153374.description:
From publisher blurb:

It Rolls Downhill is an introductory adventure for the Contagion Role Playing Game. The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface it is no different than the world you and I live in. Most people go on about their lives never realizing the terrors that walk among them. Despite humanity's vast ignorance, the horrors are there. Demons walk the night. They plot the demise of Heaven's army, but even they are not a wholly united front. Sometimes the struggle is within their own ranks...

It Rolls Downhill is an excellent introduction to the Contagion setting. In this adventure, faithful crusaders in the army of the divine are called upon to cleanse the sewers beneath the city of Rockford, IL. A Vagrant named Rufus has seen something stalking and killing his fellows in the storm drains. Has he lost his mind, or does one of Hell’s soldiers call the filth its home?

It Rolls Downhill is designed for 4-6 players of 1st to 3rd level. People familiar with other role playing games will find something unusual in the design concept of It Rolls Dowhill. Rather than being a linear module with events that go from point A to point B, this adventure offers a story seed. Basic events are illustrated, along with character snapshots. The ending is left open and ambiguous, for the Gamemaster to decide.

153375.name: Wings of the Rising Sun
153375.description:
From the publishers web site:
The NKKC (Japan Emergency Rescue Agency) is renowned as the "Wings of the Rising Sun" -- first-responders dedicated to saving lives anywhere, from Earth to Luna. When disaster strikes, these heroes deploy from fixed bases and orbital drop ships to provide aid to any country that will accept their help. Transhuman Space: Wings of the Rising Sun lets you step into the shoes of these hazard-hardened humanitarians in a campaign packed with action, drama, and surprises.

Learn all about the NKKC: its history, philosophy, staff, and organization; how it relates to Japan and the rest of the world; and why its memetics division is as top-rate as its rescue squads.
Create your own rescuers using templates for ghost/infomorph, bioroid, and human/parahuman operatives -- or dial it back a bit as a researcher or memeticist.
Explore the Agency's offices: on Earth, the "rabbit hutch" on Luna, and the 47 Hakenshitsu satellites in LEO, with full GURPS Spaceships stats for the latter and their drop ships.
Save lives with specialized NKKC technology -- Rodasha and Xenocop bioroids; Aibo, Kikko, and Tenryu cybershells; and custom microbot swarms -- or drop it into your existing Transhuman Space campaign.
Use the campaign advice and adventure seeds to throw operatives into a range of disasters, from wildfires on Earth to explosive hull failures in space.
In 2100, there are countless people taking, ruining, and exploiting lives . . . but if you want to be the group saving lives, Transhuman Space: Wings of the Rising Sun is ready to jump in and help. Join the NKKC and understand why their motto is "Even One More."

153376.name: Crazy Cat: Geheime Mission
153376.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Four crazy cats are taking part in a wild race in Crazy Cat: Geheime Mission, but who's hiding where? And which two crazy cats will reach the finish line first?

153377.name: Was ist Was: Junior – Auf der Baustelle
153377.description:
Game description from the publisher:

What's going on at the construction site? Houses are being built, roads paved, and concrete pumps are pouring basement walls. In Was ist Was - Junior: Auf der Baustelle, discovery tokens show excerpts of the giant building scene, and everyone searches at the same time to find excavators, wheel loaders, concrete mixers, dump trucks and more before anyone else.

153378.name: Waking the Dead
153378.description:
From publisher blurb:

For twenty years, the residents of Kings, Illinois have avoided the run down, two story house at 313 Second Street. Local rumor has it that the abandoned house was once home to a coven of Satan worshipers. According to legend, four evil women once lived in the house, performing dark rituals and fornicating with demons. One Halloween, during a black ritual, the local residents allegedly saw green lights glowing from the windows of the house and heard women screaming. The next day the house was abandoned and boarded up. The witches were never seen or heard from again, and the house has remained unmolested for two decades--until now.

Waking the Dead includes new system information, including rules for creating the bizarre Accursed Zombies.

Geared toward advanced characters, Waking the Dead is suggested for 4-6 PCs of 4th-7th level.

153379.name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars – Blockade von Ryloth
153379.description:
Planet Ryloth is suffering from blockades and players are tasked with destroying the enemy ships in order to free the planet’s population.

Each player sets his Jedi Sternjäger on Square One of the Score Track on the box edge. The blockade tiles are shuffled face down and ships are put into their holders, set up and placed at a minimum of one box length distance from the board.

In your turn you first turn over one blockade tile; the number on the tile determines the number of ships participating in the current blockade. One of your fellow players places this number of ships on spots of the board, in any orientation and position he likes; one of the ships must always be the Droid Control Ship. Then you as the active player take the five star chips and try to topple all ships by throwing chips at them, with a maximum of five throws. If you manage to topple all with less than five throws your turn ends with the last toppled ship. If you toppled the Droid Control Ship you score two points and you score one point for each other ship you toppled; one extra point is scored for each star chip you have left over. You move your Jedi Sternjäger forward accordingly along the box edge. If your Sternjäger reaches a score of 20 you win at the end of this round if you have most points. In a variant you must topple the Droid Ship with a certain kind of chip and score penalty points for ships you did not topple; in another version there are no given spots for the ships, you can put them anywhere.

153380.description:
Tangrams Competitive Party Game is a puzzle game for one to six players, utilizing twelve cards with silhouetted shapes that each player must hurry to duplicate with their own set of ten cardboard pieces. This edition utilizes "tans" that are different from the usual seven piece set. There are eight three-sided pieces and two four-sided pieces.

Progressive rules are included, involving the players assembling different shapes on each turn and points being awarded for the fastest completion.
153380.name: Tangrams Competitive Party Game

153382.name: Scouty: ErdBär und RäuBär
153382.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the dice game Scouty: ErdBär und RäuBär, each bear has his favorite dish, with Erdbär loving strawberries, for example, while the polar bear thinks ice cream is the best. The robber bear, however, just wants to cause mischief, so while searching for bears and their treats, you need to be sure not to catch the robber.

153383.name: Crazy Cat: Ab in den Eimer!
153383.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Crazy Cat: Ab in den Eimer!, you search in the garbage can with Crazy Cat for all sorts of fun things with which to play. Find something good? Whoosh, into the bucket! Who will be the first to fill his bucket in this collection game?

153384.name: Bystanders
153384.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most people in the world of Contagion are normal, mundane humans with normal mundane lives. In terms of the War, they are referred to as Bystanders.

They represent the largest prize in the War: souls.

This supplement contains ten ready to use characters of the Bystander class. Usable as NPCs, antagonists, or to be handed out to player characters, Bystanders is a useful tool for players and GMs!

Bystanders features:

The Activist - a strong organizer who sees an ill world and seeks to heal it.
The Bodybuilder - the product of spending years in the pursuit of physical perfection.
The Exotic Dancer - sexy, knows it and is willing to use it for profit.
The Explorer - a world traveller with years of experience and knowledge.
The Pariah - a monstrous man who just wants to be left alone.
The Penitent - a repentant crusader with a monstrous secret.
The Rough Rider - a modern cowpoke that makes his living on the rodeo circuit.
The Street Savior - a well-to-do philanthropist who is dedicated to helping the downtrodden.
The Waif - an artiste and entertainer.
The Wealthy Scion - the heir to an immense family fortune.

153385.name: The Witching Hour
153385.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Witching Hour is an intermediary adventure for the Contagion Role Playing Game. The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface it is no different than the world you and I live in. Most people go on about their lives never realizing the terrors that walk among them. Despite humanity's vast ignorance, the horrors are there.

The Witching Hour pulls the characters deeper into the Contagion setting. In this adventure, a strange but alluring woman has come to the home city of the characters (or a city nearby) and set up shop. Soon after Natalie’s arrival, missing persons reports seem to increase. The characters notice that the various supernatural factions of the city seem to have access to many more magic items. Slayers and cultists both seem to be showing up with magic tattoos with a frequency that can be no coincidence. In addition, those in the know claim that this woman knows the secret of eternal youth. Could the characters benefit from this woman? Is she a monster that must be stopped?

Geared toward advanced characters, The Witching Hour is designed for 4-6 players of 4th to 7th level. People familiar with other role playing games will find something unusual in the design concept of The Witching Hour. Rather than being a linear module with events that go from point A to point B, this adventure offers a story seed. Basic events are illustrated, along with character snapshots. The ending is left open and ambiguous, for the Gamemaster to decide.

The Witching Hour includes expanded setting and system information including a new spell: Steal Life and a new wondrous item: The Necklace of Eminence.

153386.name: Contagion Second Edition Bonus Material
153386.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface it is no different than the world you and I live in. Most people go on about their lives never realizing the terrors that walk among them.

Despite humanity’s vast ignorance, the horrors are there. Angels demons, gods and Hellspawn make war in the shadows. Clergy and Slayers rise from the human flock to protect their brethren and work God's will. Magi and Witches wield powerful magics in their pursuit of enlightenment.

There's a war in the shadows. Choose a side.

Contagion Second Edition utilizes a highly modified version of the 3.5 OGL. Contagion Second Edition provides a self-contained game system, unique in approach and design. The updated, streamlined system is familiar enough that seasoned OGL players and Gamemasters should be able to jump right in, while being simple enough for even novice gamers to quickly grasp.

The Contagion Second Edition Bonus Material supplement includes several Hellspawn, Spells and Psychic Powers that would not fit into the Contagion Second Edition corebook. This material is provided for free as a supplement for those who have purchased Contagion Second Edition, and as a preview of the system for those who have not yet picked up the game.

In this book you will find:

30 spells
16 sample magic items
25 psychic powers
40 + addiotional Hellspawn and creatures

153388.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Everything, everything is full of slackers! Sloths, hippos, lions, pandas: one is just as lazy as the next, and in Faulpelz they're all waiting to be collected by the players — but not all lazybones are the same as some animals are worth more points than others. Card by card, each player decides which animal he wants to collect, but only fully-exposed cards can be taken so look carefully and don't provide opponents the opportunity to collect the critters you want.

In the end, whoever collects the most valuable sluggards wins!
153388.name: Faulpelz

153389.name: Hobomancer Companion
153389.description:
From publisher blurb:

“So, kid, you think you know all there is to know about hobomancers? Sassafras! You ain’t know but two things—doodley and squat. You say you know about train whisperers and stinkomancers? Shoot, everybody’s heard of them, but you ain’t never met a flame singer, a hoboserker, or the fabled beardomancer. And monsters? Ha! Boogey men and hodags is one thing, but they ain’t nothing like sneaky snakes and Draculas. Now sit your backside down, kid, and let me learn you wise.”

Hobomancer Companion is the first supplement for the ENnie Award-winning* Hobomancer. Players and GMs will find new lore to help out their heroes, as well as new menaces to challenge their courage and skills. The Companion includes new hobomancer powers and secret hobomancer signs; new monsters and sample evil sorcerers; an explanation of Histories, an optional rule GMs and players can use to quickly build relationships and back-stories between PCs; and the complete adventure “Bad Train a-Coming.”

(*)2013 Silver ENnie Award for Best Electronic Book

153390.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Ninja-Flip
153390.description:
Game description from the publisher:

On the pizza, ready...ninja flip! Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael and Michelangelo have ordered their favorite pizzas in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Ninja-Flip, and once those steaming pizzas arrive at headquarters, things really start hopping as everyone wants to take a slice from everyone else while still keeping as much of their own pizza as possible.

153391.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Der kleine Drache Kokosnuss: Ausflug ins Abenteuer, the players represent the dragons Kokosnuss, Oskar and Lulu as well as the porcupine Matilda, and they want to move their characters down the path to the finish line in order to win. On a turn, the player rolls and moves — which sounds simple enough, but on their way Kokonuss and his friends will encounter forest sprites, a hungry troll, and a carnivorous plant. How will you get by these obstacles to reach Duck's flower meadow?

In Her turn player rolls the die.
There are 3 types of symbols on the die sides.
- green steps let the player move forward 2 or 3 fields
- red step let the player move backward 1 field
- with arrow player chooses how many fields each game-piece may move on the game board but only if the spinner points Her (up to 3 fields backwards or forward).

The player who finishes first is the winner.
153391.name: Der kleine Drache Kokosnuss: Ausflug ins Abenteuer

153396.name: Self-Made Space Marine
153396.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you enjoy visiting exotic locations? Meeting new people? Shooting them? If so, you might be a prime candidate for membership in the Galactic Space Marines. Just make sure to save up some cash before going to the recruitment office. The Space Marines don't want slackers, and if you can't even afford to equip yourself, you don't have what it takes. But if all your gear meets the Uniform Military Code, you can look forward to adventure, excitement, and (if you live long enough) maybe even Citizenship. Plus, you can earn big bucks (or at least enough to pay for the latest required equipment upgrade).

Self-Made Space Marine is a science fiction parody game designed for use with the QAGS Second Edition rules. It includes background on the Galactic Space Corps, an exciting new auction system for character creation, armor and weapons, Game Master tips for extorting players, the sample adventure “Prince of the Gravity Thieves,” the QAGS Qik Start rules, and more.

May the blessings of Great Zeenu be upon you. Join today!

153397.name: Zoe the Zombie Hunter
153397.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In every generation a Hunter is born. One girl in the whole world--the Chosen. She alone will stand against the zombies, the demons and the forces of evil.”

For seven seasons, audiences around the world thrilled to the exciting adventures of Zoe the Zombie Hunter and her “Josie Gang” of friends as they braved the horrors of high school, suffered heartbreaks, and occasionally fought monsters.

Now you and your friends can live your own Sunnyvale adventures with the Zoe the Zombie Hunter Role Playing Game. This 76-page PDF contains background information, GM advice, and everything else you need to adapt the Zoeverse to your role-playing game. Best of all, it’s completely Free!

153398.name: Fireworks & Primitive Firearms
153398.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call to Arms is a book line for players and gamemasters alike. Each book focuses on a different type of item, expanding rules for those items and adding everything from new mundane and magical examples of the item to new character options related to the item. Call to Arms: Fireworks and Primitive Firearms focuses on the earliest uses of gunpowder and the many different weapons of war made to use it. Starting with a general discussion of how the powder was made and improved, to how to integrate these facts into your own setting, the book moves on to introducing advanced rules for the creation of explosives and fireworks that either function as single-use firearms or simple, controlled explosions of fire and light. The capstone primitive firearm from the time period this book focuses on is the introduction of various handgonnes which were the first weapons a modern gun-owner would recognize as a true firearm. Finally, in addition to new rules for firearms in general an entire collection of magical explosives and fireworks is detailed, along with new magical wondrous items, cursed explosive powder, a mythic boomstick, an artifact of impressive destructive power and much more.

153399.name: Mekayana
153399.description:
Bundle of Holding Blurb:
This supplement for Chris Perrin's Mecha adds a touch of South Asian masala to your Japanese mecha battles. Learn about the "Bollywood" films of India, and experience the thrill of firing laser blasts as the leading man/lady in a film blockbuster. Defeat your enemies with a storm of missile fire, then earn Star Power by wooing your love with a rousing dance number. Rule the battlefield (and Bollywood) as a Leading Lady, a Character Actor, or even a Child Actor, gaining and spending Star Power to help you in the battle. Mekayana lets you travel a world of magic, mantra, and mecha.

153400.description:
Battle For Souls is a card game pitting the seven archangels of heaven versus the seven princes of hell in a fight for the eternal souls of humankind.

This pack contains six promo cards that can be added to the base game.

1. Nurture
2. Murder
3. The Holy Hand Grenade
4. The Bridge of Death
5. Holy Mystic Cowbell
6. Unholy Mystic Cowbell
153400.name: Battle For Souls: Promo Card Pack

Labyrinth Chambers is a geomorphic set, comprising 4 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each component features a winding corridors and a large room, suitable for an encounter. Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT.

Surface- a simple stone chapel with a large central space and some smaller rooms and stairs down to the crypt. Outside is a walled graveyard, trees and a small building.
Underground- a dank crypt, with dark alcoves. Extensive tunnels beneath the graveyard, including a tomb beneath a gravestone.

153407.description: The pack includes 25 questions that were created during "intense product testing" and that were not deemed appropriate for a family game or the general public either because the activities described were maybe too extreme or too sexual.

Ground Floor - a large wood-floored room, stone kitchens, outdoor areas, an archway for horses, and stairs up and down
First Floor - bedrooms and dormitories for the guests, linked by a corridor
Cellar - A dark and damp cellar, consisting of many store rooms and a secret tunnel to a hidden room.

153421.name: Crazy Cat im Müll-Versteck
153421.description:
Game description from the publisher:

All sorts of great things wait to be found hiding in the garbage! In Crazy Cat im Müll-Versteck, you'll need to put the puzzle together and start looking for these treasures. Who will be first to discover Crazy Cat and her things among the trash?

153422.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Gardens, the players work together, tile by tile, to plant, reshape and grow a garden. As opportunities arise, more and more beds will be planted. Whoever is most adept at placing his favorite plants in the garden with the help of two gardener figures and creating a majority of flowers in the most beds wins.

In Spanish

En Gardens, los jugadores trabajan juntos, pieza tras pieza, para plantar, repoblar y hacer crecer el jardín. Las oportunidades surge, más y más parques serán plantados. Quienquiera sea que pueda plantar sus plantas favoritas en el jardín haciendo que dos de sus plantas puedan crear una mayoría de flores, el que tenga más jardines ganará.
153422.name: Gardens
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 44 - Lobstercon

153423.description:
Syrtis is an abstract strategy game inspired by the undersea quicksands of the Mediterranean. Players strive to consolidate their territory as the board steadily sinks beneath the waves.

Each player has two towers which move on connected groups of tiles of that player's shape or color. Players use the towers to sink tiles (i.e., remove them from the board). As more tiles sink, players can slide the remaining tiles through the resulting empty spaces.

A player wins when all the remaining tiles of that player's shape are connected, or when the remaining tiles of that player's color are connected. A player can also win by sinking four tiles while the opponent sinks none.
153423.name: Syrtis

153424.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Hooray! Conni and her friends visit the zoo today where they'll meet animals from around the world and possibly even get to feed the meerkats. In Conni und die Tiere, the players search with Conni for the different animals, but somehow the animals aren't always where you expect them to be. Where the giraffe once stood, now there's a parrot flying around! Whoever best remembers where the animals are (and were) has an edge in this game.
153424.name: Conni und die Tiere

153425.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the adventure game North Wind, cities are suffering heavily under constant raids from pirates. As freelance trade captains, the players bring food and other goods to the cities, in addition to fighting the pirates whenever they encounter them. Fighting without cannons leads to poor results, however, and cannons are expensive. With each success, though, a player can better equip his three-dimensional ship and strengthen his crew.

In the end, the player who finds the best mix of trading and fighting will prove to be the victorious captain.
153425.name: North Wind
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 409 - Norderwind (North Wind), Give It To The King, and Liar's Dice
Garrett's Games 428 - Meeplefest 2014 Night 2, Part 2
Norderwind (Kosmos): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 234

The Game Pit: Episode 44 - Lobstercon

153426.name: Gregs Tagebuch: 10 Sekunden Balla Balla
153426.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Who can throw up Balla Balla and clap his hands five times before catching it once again? Who can place Balla Balla on his left foot, then hop three times without it falling off? Who can name four things you'd find in a garage? And who can do each of these challenges in only ten seconds?!

Gregs Tagebuch: 10 Sekunden Balla Balla includes more than ninety challenges for those waiting to be presented with a dare — or who want to dare others...

153427.name: Goof't
153427.description: Up to 4 circus animals are assembled through a series of dice rolls. Each player takes a turn and rolls the dice assembling the animal out of one of the 6 cardboard sections based on the result of the dice roll. Turns can be lost if the dreaded "GOOF" side show up or if a part already used comes up. The winner assembles their complete animal first.

153428.name: Djibouti
153428.description:
Djibouti
An Entrepreneur's Playground
The former French colony of Djibouti (jee-BOO-tee) in the present day: the economy is just starting to take off and you are a part of it!

Everyone wants to parlay their street vender origins into bigger and better things.

What small ventures will you start?

What big ventures will you invest in?

How will you outsmart your competitors?

Goal: Create the biggest business empire
- Build small ventures to accumulate capital
- Use capital to invest in big ventures
- Manipulate your competitor’s investments

Djibouti is a tableau building game where your hand of cards is used to construct buildings by playing the building card and spending additional cards for payment or expending cards as action cards to move your (or other players') capital.

Small enterprises are built in your play area, but large ones are shared in a central pool. Large enterprises all have special abilities that you can use if you invest capital, and points to score for either plurality on any card, or for having capital across sets of the same colour.

The game lasts eight rounds and the person with the high score is the winner.

153429.name: Monopoly: Adelaide Crows
153429.description:
This game is from about about the 2005 era and was a fundraiser for the Mcguiness Mcdermott Foundation. It features the Adelaide Crows Rugby team, Adelaide, South Australia.

Not to be confused with Monopoly: 20 Years of Adelaide Crows

153432.name: Blöder Sack
153432.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Five "silly bags" are waiting to be won, so it's time to prove your skill at both poker and dice — but watch out as others will be trying to grab the bags, too!

Whoever thinks he knows exactly which bag to take in Blöder Sack will likely be mistaken as players again and again hunt for the bag that holds the most — and sometimes, the bag taken earliest will turn out to be the most sweet. In the end, whoever owns the most valuable bags wins.

153433.description:
(From the game's Consimworld folder)

The Battle of Ap Bac was the first large-scale fight waged between the Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN) and the National Liberation Front (NLF). Up until this point in the Vietnam “Conflict” the NLF, soon to become known as the Viet Cong in the US, had waged a war of insurgency in South Vietnam. On January 2nd, 1963 the 7th ARVN infantry division dispatched elements of its 11th Regiment to support two Civil Guard battalions to take out a radio transmitter the NLF were operating in the hamlet of Ap Bac. This time, however, the Viet Cong chose to stand and fight. As the day wore on and the fighting escalated the ARVN were compelled to send in armor and airborne forces, as well as committing air support in a fight that decidedly went against them. It was the first stand-up fight for both sides’ forces, and one that did not bode well for those of South Vietnam. Perhaps you can do as well or better?

Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and resolve combats. Play is very interactive, easy to learn and competitive. Although designed for two players, What Went Wrong can easily be played solitaire.
153433.name: What Went Wrong: The Battle of Ap Bac, January 2, 1963

153434.name: Acute Care
153434.description:
Ever wondered what it's like to work in the stressful environment of a hospital? Do you have what it takes to ensure the health and safety of your patients who have needs that can change from minute to minute?

Acute Care is a co-operative board game in which players take on the role of nurses staffing a busy medical/surgical unit in a hospital setting. Through one 12-hour shift, they must work together to provide care for their patients and deal with emergencies and complications as they arise — ideally achieving a high level of quality while doing so.

The most precious and limited resource for real-life nurses is their time, so in Acute Care time — in the form of "time cubes" — is exactly what you must spend in order to complete tasks and care for patients. Each hour, you have six times cubes (each representing ten minutes of real time) to allocate to various tasks; cards that require you to spend time cubes have little boxes on which to place the cubes to indicate that you're performing that action.

Since the players are all working together, the Challenge Deck provides the opposition to the players throughout the game. Each card drawn from it represents some challenge or opportunity that the nurses must face in order to care for their patients and manage the unit.

Gauging success in a healthcare setting can be difficult. Having patients get better and discharging them home are the main goals, but the quality of care provided is also important, regardless of the outcome. Quality care includes patient satisfaction, staff cooperation, timeliness, performance improvement, and effective patient and family education, so in Acute Care, success is measured on a scale of quality points earned or lost, eventually leading to either Commendations (for high quality) or Deficiencies (for low quality).

153435.description:
In this follow up expansion to the original Shadowrift, Archfiends pits the heroes of legend directly against the master of each faction bent on destroying the city of Haven. In addition to the monsters faced during the course of a regular game, the heroes must now contend with the Archfiend's scheming and personal onslaught, and once the Shadowrifts are sealed the heroes must defeat this terrifying villain in mortal combat.

Archfiends expands the cooperative deckbuilding game Shadowrift. The Archfiend will have its own special deck that allows it to wade into the middle of the heroes and wreck all their plans for saving the town. There are six Archfiend decks - one keyed to each of the six monster factions from the Shadowrift base game. Will you emerge from the battle victorious? Or will the Archfiend see you bloody, battered and beaten?
153435.name: Shadowrift: Archfiends

South Gate is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.
Consisting of thick defensive walls, three gates (a main gate and two side gates), street, houses and alleys, South Gate is perfect for any adventure where your party is entering, leaving or sneaking into a city or town. South Gate can also be used as the entrace to a castle.

South Gate forms a 10 x 20 square area, and can be printed at 28mm and 25mm scale.

153442.name: Torchlit Dungeon 1
153442.description:
From publisher blurb:

Torchlit Dungeon 1 is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.
Consisting of 18 rooms and winding torchlit corridors, this versatile floorplan has many uses, such as a goblin-filled dungeon, a crypt or a treasure-filled den of horror.

Torchlit Dungeon 1 forms a 10 x 20 square area, and can be printed at 28mm and 25mm scale.

153443.name: Torchlit Dungeon 2
153443.description:
From publisher blurb:

Torchlit Dungeon 2 is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Torchlit Dungeon 2 forms a 10 x 20 square area, and can be printed at 28mm and 25mm scale.

153444.name: Zicke Zacke Ei Ei Ei
153444.description: In the children's game Zicke Zacke Ei Ei Ei, three identical wooden hens each hold one colored egg inside of them. A rooster walks around them on single tiles towards the dunghill tile. The players roll dice and change the positions of the hens between the colored nests accordingly. When the rooster arrives at the dunghill, one child crows to start the "egg-laying phase". The players now try one after the other to remember correctly and let the hens lay their egg into the nest of the same color. When the player is right, he keeps the egg. Whoever collects six eggs first wins.

153445.name: Kos Island
rpgsetting: Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting
153445.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Kos Island, the third volume of the highly-anticipated Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting! It follows Kos City and Lands Beyond Kos and is fully compatible with and expands upon concepts that appear in them.

This book contains detailed descriptions of the island of Kos, what lies around it, of its 12 major towns and villages, and of 10 specific places located on the island or smaller islets in the waters surrounding it. All of these elements can be used either individually or in conjunction with one another, and within the context of the Kos campaign setting or as part of any other campaign setting a storyteller might be using for their own games or stories. It also includes a fully-keyed map of the region, both in the book and as a separate 11 x 17 file that can be printed out on a single sheet of paper.

153446.name: Fog
153446.description:
From publisher blurb:

This series of ebooks explore the varied ways that a single spell can be adapted into new spells.

This second ebook in the series explores fog spells, offering a wide range of new spells of 1st to 6th level to expand the options for this popular type of spell. Within its pages are to be found the following:

20 Spells of the fog type.
9 new feats for lovers of fog effects.
A new feat that offers a way of making varied fog effects more accessible to wizards without them having to fill all their spell slots.




Spell Themes: Fog is spell sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

153447.name: Centaurs
153447.description:
From publisher blurb:


Speed and Thunder!

Centaurs grab life with gusto and drain it to the lees. Traveling, fighting, eating, drinking—whatever they do, they do it with vigor.

Born with grace befitting human royalty but possessed of the fierce savagery of wild horses, centaurs present unique opportunities for roleplaying and adventure!

Advanced Races: Centaurs gives you everything you need to play a centaur adventurer from one of the three known hordes: the savage Oyun, the nature-loving Ganzorig, or the mystical Yul--each usable in any campaign. This 15-page sourcebook by designer Karen McDonald includes:

11 new centaur racial traits including Fearless Marauder, Fey Upbringing, and Sage
7 new feats including Brutal Battering, Iron Hooves and Wind’s Fury
3 new archetypes: Green Witch, Oyun Wrestler and Redegiver
4 new spells and 4 new magic items
Alseid and oinataur variants
And much more!




Listen closely, adventurer—the wind is rising, evil is abroad, and the horde is ready to ride!

153448.name: The Sundered Legion
153448.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sundered Legion serves as the Series’ stunning conclusion and is written by Liz Courts and Brendan Victorson.

The fires still burn and smoke billows over the bloodstained walls of Lord Erasmus’ fortress in the Castle Ward. In the aftermath of the attempt on Erasmus’ life and the chaos that followed, the Kharel had no choice but to enact martial law to regain some semblance of order. Talquar troops stationed in the Army Ward were deployed into the city to reinforce the Night Watchmen in every ward and the city walls have been manned with full complements around the clock. As the Kharel prepares to lock down the city, tensions run high with the reports of Commander Jaken Abberbaugh’s thousand-strong army fighting in the borderlands returning to enforce Prostolom’s decree. Commander Jaken Abberbaugh, Malkan Abberbaugh’s less popular twin brother and mentored by General Uril Krakon himself, has designs upon a seat in the Kharel and has been waiting for just such order to return to the Great City. Favored by General Krakon for the position within the Kharel, and with his brother out of the way and leverage in place, his confirmation is sealed – or is it?

The City is on verge of tearing itself apart and the Kortezian Army may follow suit. Whatever happens in the next 48 hours, the Great City will never be the same.

This 48 pages adventure will take you to explore the depths of the Circus Maximus, in the Army Ward of the Great City.

The Sundered Legion is an urban adventure most suitable for 14th-16th level characters.

153449.name: The Road to Revolution: The Campaign
153449.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the most critically acclaimed campaign out there now completely converted to Pathfinder!

The Road to Revolution is a complete 320 pages campaign designed for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Set in the Great City, this epic campaign takes characters from their humble beginnings, all the way to powerful adventurers upon whose actions the City will come to depend. The Campaign Arc contains six adventures in all, each written by the original authors of the Great City Campaign Setting. Arc adventures can be played individually or linked with others in the series to create a complete campaign.

This book contains:
The Skullcrackers by John Ling - Levels 1-3
The Bloody Fix by Lou Agresta and Rone Barton - Levels 3-6
Tides of Blood by Adam Daigle, Tim Hitchcock, Greg Oppedisano - Levels 6-9
Puncture the Blackened Vein by Lou Agresta and Rone Barton - Levels 9-11
The Usurpers by Tim Hitchcock - Levels 11-13
The Sundered Legion by Liz Courts and Brendan Victorson - Levels 13-16

153450.name: The Skullcrackers: Pathfinder Conversion Guide
153450.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains information to aid in using the adventure The Road to Revolution #1—The Skullcrackers with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. (You must have a copy of The Skullcrackers to use this conversion guide.)

The Road to Revolution Campaign Arc is a series of adventures designed for use with the world’s most popular role-playing game. Set in the Great City, this epic campaign takes characters from their humble beginnings, all the way to powerful adventurers upon whose actions the City will come to depend. The Campaign Arc contains six adventures in all, each written by the original authors of the Great City Campaign Setting. Arc adventures can be played individually or linked with others in the series to create a complete campaign.

153451.name: The Usurpers: Pathfinder Conversion Guide
153451.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside this document you will find all you need to run Road to Revolution: The Usurpers adventure using the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game rules.

The Road to Revolution Campaign Arc is a series of adventures designed for use with the world’s most popular role-playing game.
